executable.title: PerformMorphological
executable.description: This program performs morphological operations such as dilation , erosion, opening and closing.

boolean.name: close
boolean.label: Close
boolean.description: Set to 1 to perform morphological closing. Default: False. Only one morphological operation can be specified. Operations are considered in the following order: dilate, erode, open, close. E.g., if dilation is specified, only it will be performed regardless of whether the other operations have requested.

boolean.name: dilate
boolean.label: dilate
boolean.description: Set to 1 to perform morphological dilation. Default: False. Only one morphological operation can be specified. Operations are considered in the following order: dilate, erode, open, close. E.g., if dilation is specified, only it will be performed regardless of whether the other operations have requested.

boolean.name: erode
boolean.label: erode
boolean.description: Set to 1 to perform morphological erosion. Default: False. Only one morphological operation can be specified. Operations are considered in the following order: dilate, erode, open, close. E.g., if dilation is specified, only it will be performed regardless of whether the other operations have requested.

boolean.name: open
boolean.label: open
boolean.description: Set to 1 to perform morphological opening. Default: False. Only one morphological operation can be specified. Operations are considered in the following order: dilate, erode, open, close. E.g., if dilation is specified, only it will be performed regardless of whether the other operations have requested.

integer.name: kernelRadiusXint
integer.label: X Kernel Radius
integer.description: Radius of morphology kernel in the x-direction.

integer.name: kernelRadiusYint
integer.label: Y Kernel Radius
integer.description: Radius of morphology kernel in the y-direction.

integer.name: kernelRadiusZint
integer.label: Z Kernel Radius
integer.description: Radius of morphology kernel in the xzdirection.

integer-vector.name: regionsVecArg
integer-vector.label: Regions vector
integer-vector.description: Users must specify chest-region chest-type pairs. only labels corresponding to the pairs will be operated on. Use this flag to specify the chest region of a given pair. Each time this flag is used, the -t or --type flag should also be used to specify the corresponding type

integer-vector.name: typesVecArg
integer-vector.label: Types vector
integer-vector.description: Users must specify chest-region chest-type pairs; only labels corresponding to the pairs will be operated on. Use this flag to specify the chest type of a given pair. Each time this flag is used, the -r or --region flag should also be used to specify the corresponding region

boolean.name: allRegionTypePairs
boolean.label: open
boolean.description: If set to 1, then all chest-region chest-type pairs present in the input label map will be processed. Any region-type pairs specified using the -r (--region) and -t (--type) flags will be ignored. (0 by default).
